p: This transmission narrative embodies what Fuentes ( 2009) describes as “niche construction”—the dynamic elaboration of mutual ecologies. Viral spread is not reducible to viral contact: Ebola emerges within a “meshwork” (Ingold 2008) of palm nuts, shotguns, national policies, and colonial pasts. It is the folding together of ecological and historical processes, the crossings of bat migrations with “imperial debris” (Stoler 2008) that create the conditions for risky commensality. The hotspot opens up the “transmission event” to the elaborate temporal and material relationalities that cultivate networks of pathogenic exchange.
